str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
